DateText: Folio: 934-935 AH/AD 1528-1529; Miniature repainted: 12th-early 13th century AH/AD 18th-early 19th century
Title: Bahram Gur Seizes the Crown After Having Killed Two Lions
Medium: ink and pigments on cream-colored laid paper
Description: In this folio from Walters manuscript W.607, Bahram Gur seizes the crown after having killed two lions.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Colophon; Headpiece; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Painting; Iran; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Yadkar al-Katib
